resources.string: This message is a test from the Failsafe Alert app.
Failsafe Alert is active! Cancel it now, or the alert will be sent.
Use the "Cancel Alarm" button in Failsafe Alert to prevent the help request from being sent.

To select or edit contacts, use the contact button in the lower right corner of the main screen.

 To remove a contact, swipe left or right on the contact name.

 To remove a phone number or email address, swipe left or right on that item.

 Contacts are saved automatically.

 Your message will be sent to all phone numbers and email addresses shown!

Set your email account username (probably your email address) in the "Email Account Username" screen.

 Set your email account password in the "Email Account Password" screen.
 Gmail users with 2-factor authentication enabled must generate an app-specific password in their Google account settings.

 Select your email server in the "Email Server Settings" screen.
 		Pick your server from the "Pick Email Server" screen. If you need a custom server, pick "Custom", then enter those settings in the "Custom server settings" screen.

Edit the message you want to have sent in the "Compose Help Request" screen.

 Set the time each day you want the cancel button to activate by picking a time in the "Enable Cancellation at" screen.

 Set the time each day you want the message to be sent if the cancel button HAS NOT been pressed in the "Send Alert at" screen.
